headline: Irving Raises The Possibility Of Surgery On Shoulder
abstract: Irving, the Nets point guard, has not played since November with a right shoulder injury. On Saturday, he said he was taking steps to avoid surgery.
lead_paragraph: Nets guard Kyrie Irving, addressing the media for the first time in two months, said on Saturday that he had taken a cortisone shot in an attempt to avoid surgery on an ailing shoulder that has kept him out of games since Nov. 14. He did not give a concrete timetable for his return but said that he was “doing a lot better.”
